member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateNotificationRule operation. Creates a notification rule for a resource. The rule specifies the events you want notifications about and the targets (such as SNS topics) where you want to receive them.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleRequest.ClientRequestToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientRequestToken.
A unique, client-generated idempotency token that, when provided in a request, ensures the request cannot be repeated with a changed parameter. If a request with the same parameters is received and a token is included, the request returns information about the initial request that used that token.
The AWS SDKs prepopulate client request tokens. If you are using an AWS SDK, an idempotency token is created for you.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleRequest.DetailType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DetailType.
The level of detail to include in the notifications for this resource. BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the resource for which the notification is created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleRequest.EventTypeIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventTypeIds.
A list of event types associated with this notification rule. For a list of allowed events, see EventTypeSummary.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name for the notification rule. Notifictaion rule names must be unique in your AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleRequest.Resource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Resource.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to associate with the notification rule. Supported resources include pipelines in AWS CodePipeline, repositories in AWS CodeCommit, and build projects in AWS CodeBuild.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleRequest.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the notification rule. The default value is ENABLED. If the status is set to DISABLED, notifications aren't sent for the notification rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of tags to apply to this notification rule. Key names cannot start with "aws".

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleRequest.Targets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Targets.
A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of SNS topics to associate with the notification rule.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateNotificationRule operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.CreateNotificationRuleResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DeleteNotificationRuleRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteNotificationRule operation. Deletes a notification rule for a resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DeleteNotificationRuleRequest.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule you want to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DeleteNotificationRuleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteNotificationRule operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DeleteNotificationRuleResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted notification rule.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DeleteTargetRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteTarget operation. Deletes a specified target for notifications.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DeleteTargetRequest.ForceUnsubscribeAll
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ForceUnsubscribeAll.
A Boolean value that can be used to delete all associations with this SNS topic. The default value is FALSE. If set to TRUE, all associations between that target and every notification rule in your AWS account are deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DeleteTargetRequest.TargetAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetAddress.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DeleteTargetResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteTarget operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleRequest.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeNotificationRule operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.CreatedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedBy.
The name or email alias of the person who created the notification rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.CreatedTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedTimestamp.
The date and time the notification rule was created, in timestamp format.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.DetailType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DetailType.
The level of detail included in the notifications for this resource. BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the resource for which the notification is created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.EventTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventTypes.
A list of the event types associated with the notification rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.LastModifiedTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedTimestamp.
The date and time the notification rule was most recently updated, in timestamp format.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the notification rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.Resource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Resource.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource associated with the notification rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the notification rule. Valid statuses are on (sending notifications) or off (not sending notifications).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags associated with the notification rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.DescribeNotificationRuleResponse.Targets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Targets.
A list of the SNS topics associated with the notification rule.

member.summary:

The level of detail to include in the notifications for this resource. BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the resource for which the notification is created.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.AmazonCodeStarNotificationsClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing CodeStarNotifications
This AWS CodeStar Notifications API Reference provides descriptions and usage examples of the operations and data types for the AWS CodeStar Notifications API. You can use the AWS CodeStar Notifications API to work with the following objects:
Notification rules, by calling the following:
CreateNotificationRule, which creates a notification rule for a resource in your account.
DeleteNotificationRule, which deletes a notification rule.
DescribeNotificationRule, which provides information about a notification rule.
ListNotificationRules, which lists the notification rules associated with your account.
UpdateNotificationRule, which changes the name, events, or targets associated with a notification rule.
Subscribe, which subscribes a target to a notification rule.
Unsubscribe, which removes a target from a notification rule.
Targets, by calling the following:
DeleteTarget, which removes a notification rule target (SNS topic) from a notification rule.
ListTargets, which lists the targets associated with a notification rule.
Events, by calling the following:
ListEventTypes, which lists the event types you can include in a notification rule.
Tags, by calling the following:
ListTagsForResource, which lists the tags already associated with a notification rule in your account.
TagResource, which associates a tag you provide with a notification rule in your account.
UntagResource, which removes a tag from a notification rule in your account.
For information about how to use AWS CodeStar Notifications, see link in the CodeStarNotifications User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.IAmazonCodeStarNotifications
member.summary:
Interface for accessing CodeStarNotifications
This AWS CodeStar Notifications API Reference provides descriptions and usage examples of the operations and data types for the AWS CodeStar Notifications API. You can use the AWS CodeStar Notifications API to work with the following objects:
Notification rules, by calling the following:
CreateNotificationRule, which creates a notification rule for a resource in your account.
DeleteNotificationRule, which deletes a notification rule.
DescribeNotificationRule, which provides information about a notification rule.
ListNotificationRules, which lists the notification rules associated with your account.
UpdateNotificationRule, which changes the name, events, or targets associated with a notification rule.
Subscribe, which subscribes a target to a notification rule.
Unsubscribe, which removes a target from a notification rule.
Targets, by calling the following:
DeleteTarget, which removes a notification rule target (SNS topic) from a notification rule.
ListTargets, which lists the targets associated with a notification rule.
Events, by calling the following:
ListEventTypes, which lists the event types you can include in a notification rule.
Tags, by calling the following:
ListTagsForResource, which lists the tags already associated with a notification rule in your account.
TagResource, which associates a tag you provide with a notification rule in your account.
UntagResource, which removes a tag from a notification rule in your account.
For information about how to use AWS CodeStar Notifications, see link in the CodeStarNotifications User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.IAmazonCodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule(Amazon.CodeStarNotifications.Model.UpdateNotificationRuleRequest)
member.summary:
Updates a notification rule for a resource. You can change the events that trigger the notification rule, the status of the rule, and the targets that receive the notifications.
To add or remove tags for a notification rule, you must use TagResource and UntagResource.
